name: pin your wings down
description: two cicada wings have been etched and hand cut then hinged together by a tiny fine silver hinge so that they can move. the smaller wing on the left is made from solid fine silver sheet and a patina has been applied so that an iridescent coloring spans the wing. the large copper wing bears cut out negative spaces where a small facaded topaz stone has been set in silver. these wings have been darkened in the vein pattern for contrast and two silver tube bails are attached on back so that the wings can be worn on a chain if desired.

name: mates
description: these pendants have been hand cast from a real walnut in bronze. i've created the piece so that the two halves of the nut fit perfectly together. the inside of the halves have been given a high shine finish in contrast with the rough exterior which i darkened enhancing the texture. these pendant have quite a bit of weight to them as they are solid bronze. wear together or give one half to your better half. pendants come on handspun jute.

name: artifact pendant 1
description:
a double pointed naturally shed deer antler tip has been sawed and filed and a handcrafted cap has been fabricated from sheet wax, then cast into bronze, and textured with burlap. the bronze has been oxidized and darkened for contrast. a bronze loop was cast in place on top of the antler cap, so that it can be worn as a pendant. hang this artifact from your favorite chain.

this listing is for the double pointed antler pendant 4th from the left.

name: artifact pendant 2
description:
a segment from a  naturally shed deer antler tip has been sawed and filed and two handcrafted caps have been fabricated from sheet wax, then cast into bronze, and textured with burlap. the bronze has been oxidized and darkened for contrast. a bronze loop was cast in place on top of each antler cap, so that it can be worn as a pendant. hang this artifact from your favorite chain vertically from both cast loops, or diagonally from one.

this listing is for the double capped antler pendant 2nd from the left.
